name: Chamilo
description: Chamilo is a learning management system focusing on ease of use, re-usability, collaboration and sharing.
description_good_justification: The description is in the website's homepage https://chamilo.org/ (fourth block)
contribution_justification: Non-trivial contribution file in repository: <https://github.com/chamilo/chamilo-lms/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md>.
contribution_requirements_justification: Non-trivial contribution file in repository: <https://github.com/chamilo/chamilo-lms/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md> including links to specific <https://support.chamilo.org/projects/chamilo-18/wiki/Coding_conventions> and generic coding conventions.
license_location_justification: Non-trivial license location file in repository: <https://github.com/chamilo/chamilo-lms/blob/master/license.txt>.
floss_license_justification: https://github.com/chamilo/chamilo-lms/blob/master/license.txt The GPL-3.0 license is approved by the Open Source Initiative (OSI).
floss_license_osi_justification: This is checked for any new library included in the code, and graphic items are Creative Commons or equivalent. The GPL-3.0 license is approved by the Open Source Initiative (OSI).
repo_public_justification: Repository on GitHub, which provides public git repositories with URLs.
repo_track_justification: Repository on GitHub, which uses git. git can track the changes, who made them, and when they were made.
repo_interim_justification: Each major version is successively published as alpha, beta, rc and then stable, for people to be able to use them. A corresponding tag is attached to each of these versions.
repo_distributed_justification: Repository on GitHub, which uses git. git is distributed.
vulnerability_report_private_justificati:
See https://support.chamilo.org/projects/chamilo-18/wiki/Security_issues
However, we believe we should improve the process to ensure submissions are using cryptography.
build_justification: Public releases do not require a build. Development releases do, and it is described in our README. See https://github.com/chamilo/chamilo-lms/blob/master/README.md
test_most_justification: This is a work in progress. The goal is to cover everything, indeed.
warnings_fixed_justification: Warning messages are checked and not allowed. Notice messages are still allowed (but frowned upon).
warnings_strict_justification: Notice messages are still allowed (but frowned upon).
know_secure_design_justification: Project leader and lead developer have contributed many security fixes, designed the security policy (and project leader is ISO:27001 certified).
crypto_working_justification: Default is SHA1, moving to BCRYPT with salt (already available but optional)
vulnerabilities_critical_fixed_justifica: So far, fix provided in 72h except one (on a total of 19 vulnerabilities)
static_analysis_common_vulnerabilities_j: We don't know of any FLOSS tool allowing to do that correctly.
dynamic_analysis_fixed_justification: All vulnerabilities reportes are fixed in a timely manner and dynamic code analysis is processed through Scrutinizer: https://scrutinizer-ci.com/g/chamilo/chamilo-lms/issues
discussion_justification: A public forum is available at https://chamilo.org/forum
hardening_justification: Not sure. Must research. We use recommendations by https://cipherli.st/ so I suppose they do. If not specific to the project management, this depends on the person installing the software.
crypto_certificate_verification_justific: Not sure. This is a web application, so it depends on the web server layer, I suppose, to check this.
crypto_verification_private_justificatio: Not sure. This is a web application, so it depends on the web server layer, I suppose, to check this.
hardened_site_justification: https://chamilo.org does not match all recommendations made by https://securityheaders.io/ yet X-Content-Type-Options was not set to "nosniff".
build_reproducible_justification: Releases do not require a build

name: gsequencer
description:
Advanced Gtk+ Sequencer is a tree based audio processing engine released under the terms of the GNU GPLv3+. It uses extensively threads, supporting LADSPA, DSSI and Lv2 plugin format.
Advanced Gtk+ Sequencer is capable of doing multi-channel editing, it contains an automation editor and you might want live export to audio files. There are sequencer machines as well a fully featured notation editor. Supporting copy & paste, resizing audio channels or align in-/output pads.

name: Power Savings tool for Linux
description:
Laptop mode is a Linux kernel feature that allows your laptop to save
 considerable power, by allowing the hard drive to spin down for longer
 periods of time. This package contains the userland scripts that are
 needed to enable laptop mode.
 .
 It includes support for automatically enabling laptop mode when the
 computer is working on batteries. It also supports various other power
 management features, such as starting and stopping daemons depending on
 power mode, automatically hibernating if battery levels are too low, and
 adjusting terminal blanking and X11 screen blanking
 .
 laptop-mode-tools uses the Linux kernel's Laptop Mode feature and thus
 is also used on Desktops and Servers to conserve power
description_good_justification:
Laptop mode is a Linux kernel feature that allows your laptop to save
 considerable power, by allowing the hard drive to spin down for longer
 periods of time. This package contains the userland scripts that are
 needed to enable laptop mode.
 .
 It includes support for automatically enabling laptop mode when the
 computer is working on batteries. It also supports various other power
 management features, such as starting and stopping daemons depending on
 power mode, automatically hibernating if battery levels are too low, and
 adjusting terminal blanking and X11 screen blanking
 .
 laptop-mode-tools uses the Linux kernel's Laptop Mode feature and thus
 is also used on Desktops and Servers to conserve power

name: GnuPG
description: GnuPG is a complete and free implementation of the OpenPGP standard as defined by RFC4880.  GnuPG allows to encrypt and sign your data and communication, features a versatile key management system as well as access modules for all kinds of public key directories. GnuPG, also known as GPG, is a command line tool with features for easy integration with other applications.
sites_https_justification: All web our web sites provide https access.  Only https based links are used to refer to GnuPG pages.
contribution_justification:
Patches shall be send to the gnupg-devel mailing list.  To allow us to apply them the author needs to send a DCO.
See https://gnupg.org/documentation/bts.html
contribution_requirements_justification: File doc/HACKING and its online version at https://gnupg.org/faq/HACKING.html
license_location_justification: File COPYING in the top directory.  Link to the the license (https://www.gnu.org/copyleft/gpl.html) from the 2nd paragraph of https://gnupg.org.index.html
floss_license_justification: Most code is under the GPL-3.0+, some code under LGPL-2.0+ OR GPL-2.0+,  some sub projects use LGPL-2.1+.  Distributed copyright is used, and there are no proprietary exceptions.
documentation_interface_justification: man page for all tools and  info document.  PDF version and HTML version of the Info file online.
repo_public_justification:
git://git.gnupg.org/gnupg.git
https://git.gnupg.org
repo_track_justification: Git is used along with a server which has write access for the core developers. See above.  Some commiters are signing commits.  Release tags have always been signed since the siwtch to git.  Release tarballs are signed.   Commit logs have in addition GNU ChangeLog style entries.
repo_interim_justification: Commits are done daily or more often.  Several release branches exist.  Developers have there own namespace on the public server.
repo_distributed_justification: git
version_unique_justification: Major.minor.micro style.  Two or three branches are maintained (currently 1.4, 2.0. 2.1)
version_tags_justification: We use signed tags named after the version number.
release_notes_justification:
NEWS file in the tarball and the announcement.   Example:
http://git.gnupg.org/cgi-bin/gitweb.cgi?p=gnupg.git;a=blob;f=NEWS
release_notes_vulns_justification:
CVE number is added to the NEWS entry and also as CVE-id in commit logs.
Example [CVE-2014-4617].
report_archive_justification: The bug tracker is piblic and has a search feature.  https://bugs.gnupg.org
vulnerability_report_process_justificati:
Description at  https://bugs.gnupg.org/documentation/security.html .
The AUTHORS file in the tarball starts with a list of URLs including a mail address for security bugs.
vulnerability_report_private_justificati:
Description at  https://bugs.gnupg.org .
We do not have a shared encryption key for the core developers but ask the reporter to request required keys via the security mail address.
build_justification: Standard GNU configure && make system on Unix.  For Windows an automated  cross-build system is part of the release.  For the latter this includes the download of all required dependecies.
build_common_tools_justification: C compiler, make, standard Unix tools.
build_floss_tools_justification: No proprietary tools are required at all.
test_most_justification: Due to extensive error handling we won't be able to reach that goal easily.   The test suite is currently changed to allow the creation of a testing suite for running that on Windows too (Windows binaries are cross-build) .
test_policy_justification: We have an informal policy that all non trivial new code  needs to have an associated test.
warnings_fixed_justification: On our main development platforms (Debian) we try to fix all warnings for a release if possible.  The Windows port has warnings but they have all been evaluated to be non-serious.
warnings_strict_justification: Newer gcc versions may introduce warnings which we can's fix immediately.  On Windows we keep the warnings as reminder for a future port to 64 bit Windows.
crypto_keylength_justification: Note that the current OpenPGP protocol requires the use of 160 bit SHA-1 for fingerprints, which we obviously must implement.   We sometimes also need to implement weaker algorithms to allow the decruption of old data.  approriate warnings are shown.
crypto_working_justification: GnuPG 2.1 has removed support for PGP-2 keys which relied on MD5.  Other branches still support MD5 with a warning.
crypto_pfs_justification: PFS for offline protocols like OpenPGP is not possible in a practical usable way
crypto_password_storage_justification: Using the S2K salted+interated methods as specified by OpenPGP.
delivery_mitm_justification:
The FTP server is also available under a HTTPS address.
All tarballs are signed by at least one core developers, the signing keys are widely distributed.
SHA-1 checksums are given in announcements.  https://versions.gnupg.org/swdb.lst{,sig} is a signed file with version information including SHA-256 checksums.  That file can be used for automated builds.
static_analysis_justification: We run clang static analyzer on our Jenkins.
dynamic_analysis_justification:
We don't run them ourself but rely on contributors who do that regulary; in particular using AFL.
There is no requirement in the release process, though.  However, major releases take place only every couple of years and the current code base has by then been analyzed.
dynamic_analysis_unsafe_justification: We use valgrind to test all new features.
dynamic_analysis_enable_assertions_justi: The C files in GnuPG alone have  about 770 call to assert and many other explicit checks for unexpected conditions.
crypto_weaknesses_justification: SHA-1, as used for OpenPGP fingerprints, has no known weaknesses in that use case (collision attacks are not a threat here).
test_continuous_integration_justificatio: A Jenkins instance is running on one machine.  We are planning to make the results public available.
discussion_justification:
Several archived mailing lists; see https://lists.gnupg.org 
https://wiki.gnupg.org
https://bugs.gnupg.org
Public XMPP channel for use by developers (gnugp-devel at conference dot jabber. gnupg.org ).
english_justification: Aside from a few language specific mailing lists and translated documentaion  English is the primary language for the project.
hardening_justification: On Unix we provide source and thus the user may add  all required compiler flags.  We are not aware of problems with these compiler flags.  (On Windows, we do not use extra protection features right now.)
crypto_verification_private_justificatio: No such private information is send.
hardened_site_justification: Only the project site uses HSTS but not bugs.gnupg.org.
installation_common_justification: Standard GNU install and uninstall make targets on Unix.  NSIS installer for Windows.

name: Samba
description: Samba is the File, Print and Active Directory Server for Unix
description_good_justification:
Since 1992, Samba has provided secure, stable and fast file and print services for all clients using the SMB/CIFS protocol, such as all versions of DOS and Windows, OS/2, Linux and many others. 

https://samba.org
contribution_justification: https://www.samba.org/samba/devel/ describes that Samba is in GIT, and points to a longer wiki article.
contribution_requirements_justification: https://wiki.samba.org/index.php/Contribute explains how to create good patches for Samba, and where to submit them (samba-technical ML or github PR)
license_location_justification: GPL license in repository: <https://github.com/samba-team/samba/blob/master/COPYING> and on website https://www.samba.org/samba/docs/GPL.html
floss_license_justification: The GPL-3.0 license is approved by the Open Source Initiative (OSI).
floss_license_osi_justification: The GPL-3.0 license is approved by the Open Source Initiative (OSI).
documentation_interface_justification: eg https://wiki.samba.org/index.php/Setup_a_Samba_Active_Directory_Domain_Controller on how to set up a new Samba4 DC
repo_public_justification:
https://git.samba.org/samba.git

Also Repository on GitHub, which provides public git repositories with URLs.
repo_track_justification: https://git.samba.org/samba.git also Repository on GitHub, which uses git. git can track the changes, who made them, and when they were made.
repo_interim_justification: The (eg) v4-3-test and master branches are updated as patches are accepted, and become tagged when released.
repo_distributed_justification: Repository on htt[s://git.samba.org/samba.git, which uses git. git is distributed. Repository on GitHub, which uses git. git is distributed.
version_unique_justification: We always bump the release number for releases, even when an embargo'ed release is withdrawn and re-released.
version_semver_justification: We are close to this, but our major version doesn't change for every incompatilbe change (eg 3. -> 4. changed for the big move to AD, the 4.0 -> 4.1 change included some incompatible changes).
version_tags_justification: All releases are tagged with signed tags. eg https://git.samba.org/?p=samba.git;a=tag;h=c673e7c0b9f11760e28158b267977887f6fc1787
report_responses_justification:
Of 470 bugs filed against Samba Aug 2017 -> Jun 2018,

https://bugzilla.samba.org/buglist.cgi?chfield=%5BBug%20creation%5D&chfieldfrom=2017-08-01&chfieldto=2018-06-01&list_id=18310&product=Samba%204.1%20and%20newer&query_format=advanced

 234 of 480 bugs were marked as resolved/fixed

https://bugzilla.samba.org/buglist.cgi?bug_status=RESOLVED&chfield=%5BBug%20creation%5D&chfieldfrom=2017-08-01&chfieldto=2018-06-01&list_id=18312&product=Samba%204.1%20and%20newer&query_format=advanced&resolution=FIXED

 and another 32 bugs were resolved by other means.  

https://bugzilla.samba.org/buglist.cgi?bug_status=RESOLVED&chfield=%5BBug%20creation%5D&chfieldfrom=2017-08-01&chfieldto=2018-06-01&list_id=18313&product=Samba%204.1%20and%20newer&query_format=advanced&resolution=INVALID&resolution=WONTFIX&resolution=LATER&resolution=REMIND&resolution=DUPLICATE&resolution=WORKSFORME&resolution=MOVED
vulnerability_report_process_justificati: https://www.samba.org/samba/contacts.html asks users to mail a private mail address for security security vulns.
vulnerability_report_private_justificati: Mail is to a private alias per https://www.samba.org/samba/contacts.html and sensitive issues can be mailed to an individual team member.
build_common_tools_justification: Samba uses WAF, which is written in python.  It is not the most common build tool, but neither is it unique.
build_floss_tools_justification: Samba can be built using entirely free software.
test_most_justification: We have an incredibly extensive testsuite, but even so code coverage above 50% is actually impractical in C based projects.
test_policy_justification: Untested code is broken code, patches are not generally accepted without tests.
warnings_justification: Our build system enabled as many -W and -Werror flags as possible.  Some warnings remain, we control where we allow some warnings at all on a per-subsystem basis to raise the bar.
warnings_fixed_justification: Because the build is run with -Werror for developers, warnings must be addressed.
warnings_strict_justification: We are maximally strict where possible, on a per-subsystem basis.  We routinely investigate new warning flags to enable and use them with -Werror to ensure they remain warning-free.
crypto_published_justification:
We match the samba crypto as windows, published in the WSPP documentation on MSDN.  

Just because the protocols are reviewed doesn't mean they are any good however (eg single DES, RC4)

https://git.samba.org/?p=samba.git;a=blob;f=lib/crypto/REQUIREMENTS;hb=HEAD
crypto_call_justification:
We still have some internal crypto that we don't link to a library for (some AES modes), but only on systems without a modern GnuTLS.

For this rule, we don't consider MD4 to be cryptography, the role is to compress the password before use in cryptography, it is never used as a checksum.
crypto_keylength_justification:
We are constrained by legacy support for NTLM, but with the default NTLMv2 we send from the client, and accept as a server we meet this. 

We support single DES for some calls (NTLM, LSA QuerySecret), and don't currently have a way to disable all use of single DES (which is the weakest link here).

https://git.samba.org/?p=samba.git;a=blob;f=lib/crypto/REQUIREMENTS;hb=HEAD
crypto_working_justification:
Constrained by needing to support NTLM and other Windows protocols but we are close enough to say 'MET', NTLMv2 is fundamentally a HMAC-MD5 scheme and SMB2 encryption is AES based.  The main challenge is RC4 in LDAP and RPC encryption. Adding more documentation would be good.

https://git.samba.org/?p=samba.git;a=blob;f=lib/crypto/REQUIREMENTS;hb=HEAD
crypto_pfs_justification: Not possible with most of our protocols.
crypto_password_storage_justification:
Constrained by support of NTLM and arcfour-hmac-md5 on Kerberos.  The hash required for arcfour-hmac-md5 is unsalted. 

The deprecated LanMan and NTLM password schemes are also not able to be salted.  It may be possible to a username salted NTLMv2 however we need to share a data storage format with Windows (as an AD DC) that precludes that.  

In short, we can't use PBKDF2 due to the protocol restrictions, and at all times the keys are password equivalent anyway.
delivery_mitm_justification:
Downloads of new versions are GPG signed and over https://.

No automatic update is provided by Samba.
delivery_unsigned_justification: GPG signatures are available, and the git repo is available over https://  As there is no automatic update this otherwise doesn't apply.
static_analysis_common_vulnerabilities_j: Coverity is very good, it knows about many things, particularly common vulnerabilities.
static_analysis_fixed_justification: Coverity issues are addressed on a continuing basis.
static_analysis_often_justification: Coverity reports are mailed to senior devs regularly.
dynamic_analysis_fixed_justification: All security issues, be they from user investigation, dynamic or static analysis are dealt with promptly.
crypto_weaknesses_justification:
Constrained by needing to support NTLM but NTLMv2 is not subject to a known serious weakness.


https://git.samba.org/?p=samba.git;a=blob;f=lib/crypto/REQUIREMENTS;hb=HEAD
test_continuous_integration_justificatio:
All code must pass autobuild before it is merged into master or a release branch.

https://wiki.samba.org/index.php/The_Samba_Selftest_System
discussion_justification: https://bugzilla.samba.org/ is our Bugzilla instance, mailing lists are archived at https://lists.samba.org/archive/samba-technical/ and subscribed at https://lists.samba.org/mailman/listinfo/samba-technical
english_justification: https://bugzilla.samba.org/ is in English, as is the Mailing list and our wiki.
crypto_used_network_justification: SMB Encryption is a new feature, not supported by many servers, therefore we can't break existing networks by requiring it to be specifically enabled.   We do however follow this criteria for LDAP however.
crypto_tls12_justification: We accept what GnuTLS provides, which includes TLS 1.2
crypto_certificate_verification_justific:
The default for 'tls verify peer' is as_strict_as_possible

https://www.samba.org/samba/docs/current/man-html/smb.conf.5.html#TLSVERIFYPEER
crypto_verification_private_justificatio: TLS is on the LDAP port and if used is used first-up.
hardened_site_justification:
X-Content-Type-Options was not set to "nosniff". # X-Content-Type-Options was not set to "nosniff". // X-Content-Type-Options was not set to "nosniff".

The https://download.samba.org site is so basic headers are not required.  There is no content management system, no javascript, etc.  Downloads are provided over TLS. // X-Content-Type-Options was not set to "nosniff".
installation_common_justification: We use the unix standard make install (which wraps waf)
build_reproducible_justification: The docs build currently embeds a build path
dco_justification: https://wiki.samba.org/index.php/Contribute directs contribubtors to our use of Signed-off-by at https://wiki.samba.org/index.php/CodeReview#commit_message_tags and the Samba copyright policy https://www.samba.org/samba/devel/copyright-policy.html (a DCO)
code_of_conduct_justification:
The Samba Team has a a document "How to do Samba: Nicely" which provides guidance in community behaviour in a practical way, based on our over 20 years of expereience in Free Software development.

https://wiki.samba.org/index.php/How_to_do_Samba:_Nicely
maintenance_or_update_justification: We describe our support for old Samba versions at https://wiki.samba.org/index.php/Samba_Release_Planning and describe any changes users need to address in the WHATSNEW file with every release. For example for 4.8.0rc1 https://download.samba.org/pub/samba/rc/samba-4.8.0rc1.WHATSNEW.txt
vulnerability_report_credit_justificatio: Credit is given routinely.  See for example https://www.samba.org/samba/security/CVE-2017-14746.html
vulnerability_response_process_justifica: Our full security process is documented publicly here: https://wiki.samba.org/index.php/Samba_Security_Process
build_standard_variables_justification: Samba uses waf as described at https://wiki.samba.org/index.php/Waf and waf honours these variables.
build_preserve_debug_justification: Builds with --enable-debug include these in the installed binaries
build_non_recursive_justification: Samba uses a full build system, not simple make files.
build_repeatable_justification: The build is reproducible except when the source directory differs, per https://bugzilla.samba.org/show_bug.cgi?id=13198
installation_standard_variables_justific: DESTDIR is honoured for make install.
installation_development_quick_justifica: Tests are a self-contained part of Samba and the normal build system produces the test environment if build with --enable-selftest.
updateable_reused_components_justificati: Except for Heimdal (for which we maintain a fork) third party components are kept under a top level directory third_party and are exact sources trees without any local patching permitted.  This allows updates by simply unpacking the new version into that directory and committing to git.
automated_integration_testing_justificat: https://wiki.samba.org/index.php/The_Samba_Selftest_System links to details of how Samba uses autobuild.py, the script run before every check-in.  Developers are e-mailed on failure.
signed_releases_justification: All releases are GPG signed. We describe that the uncompressed tarball is signed and list the key, for example see: https://lists.samba.org/archive/samba-announce/2018/000430.html
version_tags_signed_justification: Releases are marked with signed tags in the repo: https://git.samba.org/?p=samba.git;a=tag;h=b38e700ca874829b39d656b448d60ad37cd540b4
contributors_unassociated_justification: Per https://github.com/samba-team/samba/graphs/contributors and https://www.openhub.net/p/samba/contributors?sort=latest_commit&time_span=12+months there are many more than 2 significant contributors and their affiliations are described on the Samba Team https://www.samba.org/samba/team/ page.
two_person_review_justification: Samba Requires 100% of code to be reviewed: https://wiki.samba.org/index.php/CodeReview
test_statement_coverage90_justification: 90% statement coverage is practically impossible in C.
test_branch_coverage80_justification: 90% branch coverage is practically impossible in C.

name: MediaWiki
description: MediaWiki is a free software open source wiki package written in PHP, originally for use on Wikipedia. It is now also used by several other projects of the non-profit Wikimedia Foundation and by many other wikis, including this website, the home of MediaWiki.
contribution_justification:
https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/Special:MyLanguage/How_to_contribute
https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/Category:New_contributors
Information is available in dozens of languages and can be translated freely on the website itself; the software itself is available in hundreds of languages.
license_location_justification:
COPYING is used in most cases: https://git.wikimedia.org/blob/mediawiki%2Fcore.git/master/COPYING
Every extension includes license information using SPDX codes  in machine-readable metadata. https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/Manual:Coding_conventions#Licenses
Many
floss_license_justification: https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/Download The GPL-2.0 license is approved by the Open Source Initiative (OSI).
floss_license_osi_justification: The GPL-2.0 license is approved by the Open Source Initiative (OSI).
documentation_basics_justification:
https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/Help:Contents (available in dozens of languages and freely translatable: https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/Special:MessageGroupStats/agg-Help_pages )
Other documentation: https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/Documentation
repo_public_justification: Details at https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/Download_from_Git
version_tags_justification: Tags can be used to download a version from Git: https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/Download_from_Git#Specific_MediaWiki_versions
report_responses_justification:
Phabricator offers no reporting features to check whether this is true. Some statistics are collected at http://korma.wmflabs.org/
We have a bugwrangler: https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/Bugwrangler
enhancement_responses_justification:
Phabricator offers no reporting features to check whether this is true.
Some statistics are collected at http://korma.wmflabs.org/
vulnerability_report_response_justificat: Phabricator offers no reporting features to check whether this is true. The security team lately has triaged all pending security reports in our tracker (https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/Security ).
build_justification: PHP and JavaScript are the main programming languages of the project. https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/Special:MyLanguage/Manual:Installing_MediaWiki requires no building.
test_policy_justification:
Major new functionalities or large changes without tests generally get negative or no code review and don't get merged. No formal policy?
https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/Manual:PHP_unit_testing/Writing_unit_tests#Write_testable_code
tests_are_added_justification:
There's currently no way to enforce this, but code review generally blocks bigger changes without tests.
https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/Architecture_guidelines gives suggestions on how to improve testability.
warnings_strict_justification: Not clear which warnings are referred to. Testing suite, stack under the application, application errors, other?
crypto_call_justification:
pbkdf2 is the default and uses hash_pbkdf2()
https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/Manual:$wgPasswordConfig
https://git.wikimedia.org/blob/mediawiki%2Fcore/master/includes%2Fpassword%2FPbkdf2Password.php
https://secure.php.net/manual/en/function.hash-pbkdf2.php
crypto_keylength_justification:
https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/Manual:$wgPasswordConfig
We believe this rather applies to the lower layer (webserver, openssl).
crypto_working_justification: MD5 and HMAC-MD5 are used in certain non-security contexts like cache keys.
crypto_pfs_justification: We believe this rather applies to the lower layer (webserver, openssl).
crypto_random_justification:
In rare edge cases, the random number generation may fall back to a custom generator: https://git.wikimedia.org/blob/mediawiki%2Fcore/6e9b4f0e9ce4ccd6089c18b205065ef7fa077484/includes%2Futils%2FMWCryptRand.php#L316
The number is marked as weak and produces a warning upon installation: https://git.wikimedia.org/blob/mediawiki%2Fcore/d1effacdb1b8fdba8757276d85eb63593c01fd57/includes%2Finstaller%2FInstaller.php#L1648
vulnerabilities_critical_fixed_justifica: Brian Wolff says The security team (which is me and Darian) goes through all new security bug reports once a week (usually on tuesdays) and triages/responds to them. So time to initial response should be at most seven days, excluding any bugs which we file ourselves as todo notes. Often bugs will get some kind of acknowledgement prior to this meeting, particularly if its severe. David A. Wheeler says this is good enough.
dynamic_analysis_unsafe_justification: MediaWiki can ship with wikidiff2 in C++, but David A. Wheeler says I think this one is N/A, since MediaWiki isn't written in C/C++, mostly in PHP.
general_comments: We're elaborating on criteria we do/may NOT met at: https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/Core_Infrastructure_Initiative_Best_Practices_badge
crypto_weaknesses_justification: Used only in certain non-security contexts like detection of exact duplicates in files and text.
discussion_justification:
Issue tracker: https://phabricator.wikimedia.org/
Mailing lists: https://meta.wikimedia.org/wiki/Mailing_lists/Overview#MediaWiki (linkable on pipermail archives; also searchable at gmane.org and others)
One discussion page per topic: https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/Category:MediaWiki_development , https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/RfC etc. (technology: https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/Help:Talk_pages ).
no_leaked_credentials_justification: If not, please report to security@wikimedia.org
english_justification: English is the default content language, although contributions are accepted in any language with an effort to translate in as many languages as possible.
crypto_used_network_justification:
Internal requests follow the specified protocol and are not downgraded: https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/Manual:$wgCanonicalServer
External requests are disabled by default and generally target HSTS domains, like https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/InstantCommons#HTTPS
HTTP requests are allowed: https://git.wikimedia.org/blob/mediawiki%2Fcore/master/includes%2FHttpFunctions.php , https://git.wikimedia.org/blob/mediawiki%2Fcore/master/includes%2FHttpFunctions.php
crypto_tls12_justification: Relies on PHP openssl extension and webserver.
hardened_site_justification:
X-Content-Type-Options was not set to "nosniff".
See also https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/Manual:$wgBreakFrames , https://phabricator.wikimedia.org/T92002 , https://meta.wikimedia.org/wiki/HTTPS#2015 X-Content-Type-Options was not set to "nosniff".

name: TestDisk & PhotoRec

TestDisk is a tool to check and undelete partitions.
PhotoRec is a signature based file recovery utility.
contribution_justification: Projects on GitHub by default use issues and pull requests, as encouraged by documentation such as <https://guides.github.com/activities/contributing-to-open-source/>.
license_location_justification: Non-trivial license location file in repository: <https://github.com/cgsecurity/testdisk/blob/master/COPYING>.

floss_license_osi_justification: The GPL-2.0 license is approved by the Open Source Initiative (OSI).

repo_distributed_justification: Repository on GitHub, which uses git. git is distributed.

https://www.cgsecurity.org/grenier.asc

Otherwise, testdisk and photorec can be run without installation (portable software)

name: bigbro

license_location_justification: Non-trivial license location file in repository: <https://github.com/droundy/bigbro/blob/master/LICENSE>.
floss_license_justification: The GPL-2.0 license is approved by the Open Source Initiative (OSI).
floss_license_osi_justification: The GPL-2.0 license is approved by the Open Source Initiative (OSI).

repo_track_justification: Repository on GitHub, which uses git. git can track the changes, who made them, and when they were made.

with a test harness here:

contribution_justification: Projects on GitHub by default use issues and pull requests, as encouraged by documentation such as <https://guides.github.com/activities/contributing-to-open-source/>.
license_location_justification: No license location file found.
repo_public_justification: Repository on GitHub, which provides public git repositories with URLs.
repo_track_justification: Repository on GitHub, which uses git. git can track the changes, who made them, and when they were made.
repo_distributed_justification: Repository on GitHub, which uses git. git is distributed.
discussion_justification: GitHub supports discussions on issues and pull requests.
hardened_site_justification: Found all required security hardening headers.

contribution_justification: Projects on GitHub by default use issues and pull requests, as encouraged by documentation such as <https://guides.github.com/activities/contributing-to-open-source/>.
license_location_justification: Non-trivial license location file in repository: <https://github.com/agrare/ipc/blob/master/COPYING>.
